Images.Name: i0
Images.Description: Nuclear envelope atypia and rupture in human glioblastoma

Header:
This sample is from a patient (76 year old male) with IDH-wildtype glioblastoma within the left frontal lobe, who underwent a surgical resection of the primary tumor. Here we display a specimen that was collected during this surgery and imaged using cyclic immunofluorescence (CyCIF).

#**Metadata about this sample:**
## Diagnosis  
**Age at Diagnosis:** 76  
**Primary Diagnosis:** Glioblastoma  
**Site of resection:** Left Frontal Lobe  
**Tumor Grade:** IV  
**Genetic features:**   - IDH-wildtype (via IHC)  
 \- MGMT-methylated  (via PCR)  

## Demographics
**Species:** Human  
**Sex:** Male  
**Race:** White  
**Ethnicity:** Not hispanic or latino

## Follow Up
**Vital status:** Deceased  
**Progression-free Survival:** 407 days  
**Overall Survival:** 677 days  

## Biospecimen
**Acquisition Method Type:** Surgical resection

## Therapy
**Pre-operative:** None  
**Post-operative:** Temozolomide (TMZ) and radiotherapy

## Imaging
**Imaging Assay Type:** CyCIF  
**Fixative Type:** Formalin  
**Microscope:** Zeiss LSM980  
**Objective:** 40x/1.3

Due to an error in the registration step of image processing, some of the channels are missing signal in the top left corner of the image.

Waypoints.Name: Glioblastoma Lineage Differentiation
Waypoints.Description: Glioblastoma cells primarily exist in four molecular cell states: oligodendrocyte progenitor cell-like (OPC), neural progenitor cell-like (NPC), astrocyte-like (AC), and mesenchymal-like (MES). This a representative section that demonstrates the heterogeneity of cell states in glioblastoma. OPC cells are marked by SOX10, NPC cells are marked by ELAVL4, AC cells are marked by SOX9, and MES cells are marked by HIF1a.

Waypoints.Name: Primary Nuclear Rupture is Correlated with Lamin Expression
Waypoints.Description: In glioblastoma, primary nuclear rupture is inversely correlated with lamin A/C expression, with more frequent primary nuclear BAF foci in cells with low lamin A/C. Lamin A/C frequently shows low or heterogeneous expression in glioma cells, as demonstrated in this region of the tissue.

Waypoints.Name: Nuclear Rupture in Glioblastoma Cell Types
Waypoints.Description: BAF foci are enriched in tumor cells (SOX2+) relative to other cell populations in the tumor microenvironment such as endothelial cells (CD31+) or myeloid cells (TMEM119+).

Waypoints.Name: Primary Nuclear Rupture
Waypoints.Description: Glioblastoma tissue shows frequent rupture of the primary nucleus, and may sometimes show accumulation of the innate immune marker cGAS and the DNA damage marker pH2AX. Note a second overlapping cell with a ruptured primary nucleus.

Waypoints.Name: Micronuclear Rupture
Waypoints.Description: Glioblastoma tissue shows frequent formation and rupture of micronuclei. Shown is a representative example of a ruptured micronucleus with accumulation of BAF, the innate immune effector cGAS, and DNA damage marker pH2AX.

Waypoints.Name: Chromosomal Bridging
Waypoints.Description: Mitotic mis-segregation may lead to the formation of chromosomal bridges, which may rupture and lead to genomic instability and chromothripsis. 3D imaging shows that chromosomal bridges are common in glioblastoma, and exhibit a complex architecture and may span long distances and show hairpin turns, such as the representative example shown here. This chromosomal bridge ends on a focal rupture with BAF and pH2AX accumulation.
